text: Charles Ingerham “Chuck” Peddle (November 25, 1937 - December 15, 2019) was an American electrical engineer. He was born in Bangor, Maine. He was best known as the main designer of the MOS Technology 6502 microprocessor, as well as the KIM-1 SBC (single-board computer) and the Commodore PET PC (personal computer). Peddle died at the age of 82 on December 15, 2019 at his Santa Cruz, California home of pancreatic cancer. ==References== ==Other websites== * The Legendary Chuck Peddle, Inventor of The Personal Computer * Chuck Peddle tells his story on The Amp Hour Podcast Category:1937 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:Engineers from Maine Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from Maine Category:People from Bangor, Maine
